intro: Acacia lathouwersii, commonly known as the Lathouwers' acacia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils and saline conditions. Its small, yellow flowers are clustered in spherical inflorescences, and it is often used in coastal stabilization due to its hardy nature. Acacia lathouwersii is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting local wildlife.

This species is commonly found in dune environments and is well adapted to coastal conditions, including salt spray and strong winds.
